title: Add simple password protection to admin dashboard

requirements.summary: Update PasswordAuth component to use configurable password from environment variable or configuration instead of hardcoded value
acceptanceCriteria: Password is stored in a configuration file or environment variable instead of being hardcoded
Admin can change the password without modifying component code
Password input and validation logic remains unchanged

file_operations.description: Replace hardcoded 'admin123' password with a configurable password imported from the configuration file. Update the password validation logic to compare against the imported ADMIN_PASSWORD constant while maintaining existing sessionStorage-based authentication flow and UI structure.

requirements.summary: Add password configuration to a centralized location for admin authentication
acceptanceCriteria: Password is stored in a centralized location
Configuration is easy to locate and update
Password remains functional with existing PasswordAuth component

file_operations.description: Create new configuration file that exports ADMIN_PASSWORD constant. This constant should be set to a default value (e.g., 'admin123') but can be overridden via environment variables. Include a comment explaining how to change the password for production use.

requirements.summary: Add Hindi error message for incorrect password attempts in admin authentication
acceptanceCriteria: Error message is stored in the Hindi content file
Message clearly indicates incorrect password in Hindi
PasswordAuth component can reference this message

file_operations.description: Add a new auth section to the content object containing an incorrectPasswordError message in Hindi (e.g., 'गलत पासवर्ड। कृपया पुनः प्रयास करें।'). This message should be clear and user-friendly for incorrect password attempts.

Import the Hindi content file and use the incorrectPasswordError message from the auth section when displaying password validation errors. Update the error state handling to reference this localized error message instead of any hardcoded English text.
